quotes.quote: Artwork is a representation of our devotion to life.
I think the optimal artwork is in constant circulation with the world around itself.
Artwork can be a portal, a kind of rethinking and reseeing of the world as we live it.
While some part of the artwork may fail, the whole may have its own unique importance.
The seed of your next artwork lies embedded in the imperfections of your current piece.
There is much to be said for the artwork that answers horror by rejecting or transcending it.
Whenever you finish an artwork and the viewer comes and views it, at that moment you've given up control.
An artwork should point in more than one direction, not be this sort of placating, self-demonstrating, witnessing element.
How can anybody learn anything from an artwork when the piece of art only reflects the vanity of the artist and not reality?
I think that artworks are like these spiritual objects: I think that they have energies and powers beyond what the eye can see.
To make an artwork good enough to enter people's hearts is like what ancient Chinese called 'making stone into gold.' It is alchemy.
To give a price to an artwork, no matter how high or low, is always absurd. It's not something that can be measured by money or by certain numbers.
The artwork had very little to do with the thought process, and the writing too, for that matter. What happens, happens, and it happens outside the brain.
Attention is what creates value. Artworks are made as well by how people interact with them - and therefore by what quality of interaction they can inspire.
Some visual artworks are made to be talked about more than to be seen, others are made to be seen more than to be talked about. I think I belong in the latter category.
Artwork is not like a commercial business; there is no such thing as a schedule for art. You can't hurry art.

Artwork is not thought up in consciousness and then, as a separate phase, executed by the hand. The hand surprises us creates and solves problems on its own. Often, enigmas that baffle our brains are dealt with easily, unconsciously, by the hand.

Artwork operates on two different levels: On one level there's artwork as a mode of expressivity, and then there's the other side, where the image is a construction that is meant to engage in a discursive field in order to preform a particular function.
The promise of any artwork is that it can hold us - viewer and maker - in a conflicted or contestable space, without real-world injury or loss.
A work of art expresses itself as a balance sheet pitting the spoken against the unspoken.
Every single work of art is the fulfillment of a prophecy; for every work of art is the conversion of an idea into an image.
The true work of art continues to unfold and create within the personality of the spectator. It is a continuous coming into being.
A work of art is one through which the consciousness of the artist is able to give its emotions to anyone who is prepared to receive them.
A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.
A work of art is the trace of a magnificent struggle.
A work of art which did not begin in emotion is not art.
Only the work of art itself can raise the standard of taste.
A work of art doesn't dare you to realize it. It germinates and gestates by itself.
Every work of art is the child of its time, often it is the mother of our emotions.
A work of art is a world in itself reflecting senses and emotions of the artist's world.
Any artwork needs time and patience and needs above a quiet mind.
The digital artwork is characterized not by the technology which delivers it, but by the "passage" itself.
Any artwork is part of something larger, grander and, you know, the situation that it's in is very important.
In an artwork you're always looking for artistic decisions, so an ashtray is perfect. An ashtray has got life and death.
Any work of art dignifies life.
The work of art is the exaggeration of an idea.
The work of art is a scream of freedom.
Any work of art ... is great when it makes you feel that its creator has dipped into your very heart for his sensation.
Any genuine work of art generates new work.
Every work of art depicts an aspect of reality.
Any work of art must first of all tell a story.
A work of art comes only from inside a human being.
The work of art is above all a process of creation.
In every work of art, the artist himself is present.
A work of art comes out of a state of deep stillness.
Every true work of art must express a distinct feeling.
Every authentic work of art is a gift offered to the future.
A great work of art is one that continues to repay attention.
A true work of art can stand many seeings, revealing anew at each seeing.
Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.
